bill_title: establish certain procedures for counties to follow when requiring landowners to cut and remove grass, weeds, and brush from the road right-of-way.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish certain procedures for counties to follow when requiring landowners to cut and remove grass, weeds, and brush from the road right-of-way. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 31-31-1 be amended to read as follows: 31-31-1. The Department of Transportation and each board of county commissioners of the various counties shall cut or remove, or cause to be cut or removed, grass, weeds, and brush growing within the right-of-way of all public highways within their respective under its jurisdiction and over which such the department and boards exercise or board exercises control as to repair and maintenance. The board of county commissioners may require, by ordinance, the owner or occupant of any land abutting or adjoining a county road to cut or remove grass, weeds, and brush, growing on or in the road right-of-way. If the owner or occupant does not cut or remove grass, weeds, and brush, the board may levy a special assessment against the abutting or adjoining property to pay the cost of such cutting and removal. A violation of this section is a petty offense. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish certain procedures for counties to follow when requiring landowners to cut and remove grass, weeds, and brush from the road right-of-way. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 31-31-1 be amended to read as follows: 31-31-1. The Department of Transportation and each board of county commissioners of the various counties shall cut or remove, or cause to be cut or removed, grass, weeds, and brush growing within the right-of-way of all public highways within their respective under its jurisdiction and over which such the department and boards exercise or board exercises control as to repair and maintenance. The board of county commissioners may require, by ordinance, the owner or occupant of any land abutting or adjoining a secondary road located within an unorganized township to cut or remove grass, weeds, and brush, growing on or in the road right-of-way. If the owner or occupant does not cut or remove grass, weeds, and brush, the board may levy a special assessment against the abutting or adjoining property to pay the cost of such cutting and removal. A violation of this section is a petty offense. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
